page.title: 06The Village Blacksmith
page.content: In tales of villages the {Blacksmith} is often mentioned. Near to our school is a garage. The garage repairs cars, does MOT's and work for the farmers. It once sold petrol but the pumps are now empty. The garage was once the Smithy, and the {forge}is still used but not to shoe horses. The owner makes parts for vehicles or agricultural machines or pieces of decorative ironwork. The present owner has lived in the village for all of his life and his father was the blacksmith before him. All the tools of this trade can be found in the garage today. The forecourt of the garage is often used by the Girl Guides for carwashing.
